intro: Ajax pseudonarcissus var. festalis, commonly known as the Festal Crowned narcissus, is a variety of the genus Narcissus native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its distinctive, showy white petals with a yellow center and a unique crown-like pattern on the flower. The plant typically grows to a height of about 20-30 cm and produces a single, large flower per stem. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, blooming in late winter to early spring. This cultivar is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its elegant appearance.
